name: Prettypullrequests
tagline: A chrome extension to make reviewing pull requests in Github a little easier.
body:
# Pretty Pull Requests

This extension will add various features to the diff view on Github's pull request pages.

Supports both files changed and commit diffs.

Current Features:
- Click on the file name to collapse a file
- Collapse/Expand all
- Collapse/Expand all that match a criteria
- Collapse/Expand added/removed lines
- Move the close pull request button slightly away from the comment button


**Collapse Diffs:**
![Collapsed Diffs](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7331/8715118495_c3fb94643e.jpg)
Simply click anywhere on the path (cursor will turn to the hand).


**Collapse/Expand all, or any path containing a word:**
![Collapse All](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7460/8716234498_8150acfc7a.jpg)
Collapse/Expand all with an empty path, or type a word to match any part of the path and collapse/expand any diffs that match. Note: it IS case sensitive.


**Collapse/Expand Additions/Deletions:**
![Normal](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7369/8715115615_73bfc1dca6.jpg)![Collapsed](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7354/8716234474_22fc65c4dd.jpg)
Note the checkboxes on the top right of the diff that are added to control this feature.


**Moved close pull request button away and gave it a better name:**
![Close Button](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7310/8716234428_653fbdd20b.jpg)
This helps prevent closing the pull request due to annoying misclicks.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
